name: Sea Crest Beach Hotel

reviews.text: Seriously, we will just keep coming back because of the serious attention the staff puts into making sure the guest is enjoying their stay. I have had the pleasure of talking with the manager Clark many times, and suffice to say he is very proud of the staff he has assembled at Sea Crest - and well he should be! Clark is a very nice gentleman who himself will go out of his way to assist the guest, so it is easy to see that he leads by example.
reviews.title: Treated like Royalty

reviews.text: Our stay this time: First impressions. Upon arrival I was greeted by Mike at the front desk and explained to him that our 1 year old Son had been having a hard time making it through the night without a few crying outbursts lately, and as a courtesy to any guests on either side of us I was hoping to get an end unit (thus only one guest might be bothered), or a room that had no one on either side. I already knew there was a big event planned that Saturday night, so I didn't expect miracles, but Mike very cordially invited us into a complete upgrade to a fireplace king suite that was an end unit with no one next door.....now, how perfect was that! Just brilliant, and kudos to Mike. I asked him what the procedure was to use the pool at Holiday Inn (since Sea Crest's pool/workout area is undergoing serious renovations - re-open again May 15), and he handed me a card that allowed us to show up over there and get towels and use the pool. Overall, a fantastic and VERY fast check-in procedure.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Ocean Front Views and Great Service

reviews.text: I love the prime rib over at Jay Miller's place (Courtyard), so we decided to have dinner over there with my Cousins but I will say we were curious to see if the menu at Red's was still as good as the last time. Well, we didn't have to wait long to get our answer. We started the day off with the fabulous Sunday buffet in the main dining room. Great omellette and waffle stations served by very friendly cooks. There really is everything you could hope to find in a buffet, although I will say that it is a little steep at $18/person when there is no carving station or champagne - doesn't bother me, but as a reviewer I felt it worth a mention. Our waitress, Sierra, was fantastic, and it is not the first time she has been great for us. We then got out and about to enjoy the sunny but chilly 50 degree day. At 3 pm we decided lunch was in order and called over my Cousins to join us for lunch at Red's - and here is where the fun started. We literally sat in that restaurant/bar from 3 pm to 10 pm (close), just talking and hanging out with the staff and having a great time. The food was great starting with the scallops and going to the sandwiches we had for lunch, they even made chicken fingers that weren't on the menu out of season for our Son - - - dinner was great too!! We started off with the bartender Ryan, who I remembered (and he remembered me as well) from the first time we were at Sea Crest with the new ownership and he had helped me carrying drinks up to the room. Great guy. Then Tom, the new bartender came on, and we got inventive and started making new drink recipes (ok, old ones, but pretty exotic stuff like a Bermuda Rum Swizzle!). Lots of fun. I had a nice chat with Michael the restaurant manager who was a great guy as well, and even our old friend the waitress Laurie stopped by to say hi. It just felt like we were hanging out with friends and relatives, that is the atmosphere that Sea Crest instills - a true vacation!
reviews.title: A Perfect Getaway!

reviews.text: Bottom-line, when you need to relax and be pampered a bit on vacation, as well as being treated like part of the family, make sure that you consider Sea Crest, we always will!!!
reviews.title: Looking good!
One of the best on the Cape
reviews.text: The view of the ocean and sunsets are breathtaking. The room was modern and comfortable and the ocean view was lovely. The renovation seems to be wrapping up in the indoor pool area - will be interesting to see how it turns out. The restaurant was very nice and the service good. Other reviews complained about the prices but coming from Boston, I found them reasonable. All of the staff were warm and responsive. Even though it was "off season", it was full of activity and we were greeted everywhere by the staff and offered help.
Was here for the very first time in America seeing Boston and cape cod.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was here for a wedding and was a fantastic stay, great rooms, and location service was very friendly, and very clean rooms. Would diffinatly come here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location Right on the Beach

reviews.text: We are staying at the Sea Crest because we got a deal on Snique Away last month. The location is beautiful. We have an oceanfront room and the beach is right within feet of the deck. The hotel is still under renovations and the pool and jacuzzi are not open which was very disappointing. The other disappointment was that there was no restaurant at the hotel but I'm sure once it is all done, it was be great. Our room is a very nice size and very clean. I requested a quiet location and got one. There is no elevator in our building so to go up and down with bags you have to take the stairs so if you don't want that, ask for a first floor location. The staff was wonderful on arrival. Mariah was very nice and Lamont who helped carry my heavy bags up to our room taking the stairs was very nice. Don't hesitate to stay here if you are looking for a getaway right on the beach that is close to everything, shopping, food and cape cod living.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot right on the beach

reviews.text: Looking for a nice little getaway for my ailing aunt to enjoy the ocean, and boy did we find it. The oceanfront room was literally right on the beach, steps away from the ocean. The decor was nice and room was very clean and tidy. The staff was very accomodating and provided us a wheelchair and all extra help we needed. We had dinner in the hotel's restaurant hotel which also had a dining room with an excellent view of sunset right over the water. Service in the restaurant was OK, being out of season, it appeared that they may have been slightly understaffed, but the food was delicious! No free continental breakfast, and the charge for the breakfast offered in the ballroom seemed high, which was disappointing but the front desk directed us to a lovely and inexpensive diner not to far from the hotel, so we appreciated the referral. We plan on taking my aunt back for Mother's Day if she is well enough to go!
reviews.title: King Room with Fireplace Room 815 on 4/16/2012
Dance camp dinner at Sea Crest
reviews.text: The room was larger than most hotel rooms; the bathroom was roomy as well and had a double sink. We did not feel cramped and the room seemed clean and updated. Fireplace did not work, someone had to come and turn it on and we had to leave it on, once we shut it off, it never turned back on. The pull out couch looked new, but no bedding was provided, had to call for bedding. Both times service (fireplace & bedding) was quick and friendly. The hotel was under construction, so the indoor pool and hot tub were closed and part of our stay the bathrooms were under construction so while we played on the beach we had to go to the other side of the hotel to use the bathroom. We ate at Reds, the items on the menu are bit overpriced. Of season, they were only serving breakfast; an omelet with a handful of home fires that were over cooked and two strips of bacon was 10 dollars. Overall it was a nice place, and I would stay there again, but I would not eat at Reds again because the food was just ok for the prices they were charging. All of the staff was friendly, the beach was somewhat clean and the board walk had broken boards. Like I said, they were under construction, so we did not expect perfection, but we did expect to use the indoor pool and spa and were disappointed when we got there to find out it was closed. We feel they should have told over the phone when we called to make a reservation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To my delight, my husband surprised me with a little getaway for the both of us on Valentine's Day weekend. This was a special package that was offered which included dinner, an overnight stay, and breakfast. Let me start by saying our room was gorgeous. There was sparkling wine and an array of desserts awaiting us (chocolate covered strawberries and other assorted chocolates). The room was immaculate, and the fireplace just topped off our romantic evening.
reviews.title: Valentine's Day Package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the restaurant we were greeted immediately and seated in an area with other guests taking advantage of this package, but each table was arranged so that you felt you were in a private setting. Our server was courteous and prompt. We had two options for our meal. We selected one of each and shared! The food was perfect and presentation was impressive. The selection of dessert was endless!
reviews.title: Bright and Cheery
Good to be back
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent. They served large portions, and the staff was friendly and helpful.
I would definitely take advantage of another package offered at Sea Crest Beach Resort.
reviews.title: Excellent Location And Renovation...Spotty Service

reviews.text: I would give this hotel 3 1/2 stars if possible, it was above average. Only a few minor glitches. To start, they are currently under renovation so some outdoor areas are cluttered with building materials and such. I'm sure when spring rolls around it will be all cleaned up.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sea Crest Beach Hotel on a last minute Memorial Day weekend trip, booked through Hotwire. We went in not knowing what to expect but came away pleasantly surprised and nicely relaxed. We've historically visited the outer ("lower") Cape over the last 25 years, so Falmouth and environs were relatively new and unexplored for us. In fact, during this trip, we took our two children to the Chatham Bars Inn, where we were married 20 years ago.
reviews.title: A nice waterfront resort and a study in contrasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Actually, the CBI provides an interesting contrast and point of reference for the Sea Crest...
reviews.title: Great except for the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where the Chatham Bars is plaids and Lily Pulitzer, the Sea Crest runs more toward bikinis and board shorts and more than a few full sleeve tattoos and butterfly lower back tattoos, too.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Where the CBI is cocktails and crab cakes on the veranda or the deck of the Beach House, the Sea Crest is boat drinks in plastic cups by the pool or overlooking the beach.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL STAY AT THE SEACREST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where the CBI is 100-year old shingle style, gently renovated and added to till there is no greenspace left anywhere on its gold-coast locale, the Sea Crest is 60s and 70s resort motel tweaked tastefully to a fare-the-well (the renovations have taken the Sea Crest to another dimension, and the rooms in particular are amazing given their humble origins).
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach Front

description: Sea Crest Beach Hotel is located on one of the most beautiful beaches on Cape Cod. Just 70 miles from Boston, Sea Crest Beach Hotel is perfect for a wedding, reunion, corporate event, or just that perfect Cape Cod vacation, Sea Crest Beach Hotel on Old Sliver Beach will make your time on Cape Cod memorable. Sit by our outdoor saline pool, lie on our pristine, white sand, beach overlooking Buzzards Bay, go windsurfing, swimming, or just relax with a good book. The Sea Crest Beach Hotel is Cape Cod’s finest.
